dt: {bc}a {a_link|closable} gap (as in an article of clothing)
{bc}a meeting of parties to a real-estate deal for formally transferring title

shortdef: a concluding part (as of a speech)
a closable gap (as in an article of clothing)
a meeting of parties to a real-estate deal for formally transferring title

dt: {bc}to move so as to bar passage through something
{bc}to suspend or stop the operations of
{bc}to bring to an end or period

dt.t: {it}closed{/it} his football career with an outstanding big bowl performance
Investigators {it}closed{/it} the case after concluding that his death was accidental.

dt: {bc}to terminate access to (a computer file or program)

dt.t: Remember to save the file before {it}closing{/it} it.

dt: {bc}to consummate {dx_def}see {dxt|consummate:2||2}{/dx_def} by performing something previously agreed

dt.t: {wi}close{/wi} a transfer of real estate title

dt: {bc}to bring or bind together the parts or edges of

dt.t: {it}closed{/it} the distance to the lead racer

dt: {bc}to fill up (something, such as an opening)

dt.t: {wi}close{/wi} the cracks with plaster of paris

dt: {bc}to make complete by circling or enveloping or by making continuous
{bc}to contract, fold, swing, or slide so as to leave no opening
{bc}to draw the free foot up to the supporting foot in dancing
{bc}to come to an end or period

dt.t: The services {it}closed{/it} with a short prayer.

dt: {bc}to enter into or complete an agreement

dt.t: The ship was {it}closing{/it} with the island.

dt: {bc}to engage in a struggle at close quarters {bc}{sx|grapple||}

dt.t: The nation {it}closed its doors{/it} to immigrants.
The furniture store {it}closed its doors{/it} last week.
Officials {it}closed their eyes to{/it} allegations of child abuse at the day care center.

dt: {bc}to unite in a concerted stand especially to meet a challenge

dt.t: The family {it}closed ranks{/it} to protect one of their own.

pt: {sc}close{/sc} {sc}end{/sc} {sc}conclude{/sc} {sc}finish{/sc} {sc}complete{/sc} {sc}terminate{/sc} mean to bring or come to a stopping point or limit. {sc}close{/sc} usually implies that something has been in some way open as well as unfinished.
{sc}end{/sc} conveys a strong sense of finality.
{sc}conclude{/sc} may imply a formal closing (as of a meeting).
{sc}finish{/sc} may stress completion of a final step in a process.

pt.t: after it is painted, the house will be {it}finished{/it}

pt: {sc}complete{/sc} implies the removal of all deficiencies or a successful finishing of what has been undertaken.

pt.t: the resolving of this last issue {it}completes{/it} the agreement

pt: {sc}terminate{/sc} implies the setting of a limit in time or space.

et: Middle English, from Anglo-French {it}clos-{/it}, stem of {it}clore{/it}, from Latin {it}claudere{/it} to shut, close; perhaps akin to Greek {it}kleiein{/it} to close {ma}{mat|clavicle|}{/ma}
shortdef: to move so as to bar passage through something
to block against entry or passage

dt: {bc}the extra amounts of money that people need to pay when they buy a house

shortdef: the extra amounts of money that people need to pay when they buy a house

dt: {bc}the price of a stock or bond at the end of a day

shortdef: the price of a stock or bond at the end of a day

dt: {bc}the time when businesses (such as banks and bars) close for the day

shortdef: the time when businesses (such as banks and bars) close for the day

dt: {bc}closing or shutting automatically after being opened

shortdef: closing or shutting automatically after being opened

dt: {bc}to enshroud to such an extent as to preclude entrance or exit

dt.t: the airport was {it}closed in{/it} by the storm

dt: {bc}to gather in close all around with an oppressing or isolating effect
{bc}to approach to close quarters especially for an attack, raid, or arrest

dt.t: the short November day was already {it}closing in{/it}

shortdef: to enshroud to such an extent as to preclude entrance or exit
to gather in close all around with an oppressing or isolating effect

dt: {bc}to dispose of a whole stock of by sale

dt.t: {it}closed out{/it} his share of the business

dt: {bc}to put (an account) in order for disposal or transfer
{bc}to bring to an often rapid or abrupt conclusion
{bc}to buy or sell securities or commodities in order to terminate an account

shortdef: to dispose of a whole stock of by sale

dt: {bc}the words (such as {it}sincerely yours{/it}) that conventionally come immediately before the signature of a letter and express the sender's regard for the receiver

shortdef: the words (such as sincerely yours) that conventionally come immediately before the signature of a letter and express the sender's regard for the receiver —called also complimentary closing

dt: {bc}to not allow (something) to be used for a period of time {bc}close

dt.t: The city {it}closed off{/it} the beach to tourists.
Half of the museum was {it}closed off{/it} while they made the changes.

shortdef: to not allow (something) to be used for a period of time : close —sometimes used figuratively
